  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND AT BAY 3, AND PROCCEED TO DMP AREA. RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A WET AUTOMOTIVE BATTERY WITH NO COVERAGE OR SPILL BAG INCASE SOLUTION COMES OUT. THERE WERE PACKING PAPER AND SINGLE LAYER WALL, HEAVIELY STUFFED INSIDE.

item.title: Report E-2024040519
item.description:
Report E-2024040519

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: ZELLWOOD
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of GreenClean Alkaline Cleaner was damaged in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Compliance Technologies (ACT) to remediate the impacted site. ACT personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the Green Clean Alkaline Cleaner-impacted trailer. All impacted absorbents and waste were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket and taken by ACT crews for disposal. The damaged container of product was overpacked and transported by R+L back to the terminal.

item.title: Report E-2024040466
item.description:
Report E-2024040466

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a one gallon release of regulated UN1824 "Instant Power Main Line Cleaner" arrived damaged at Terminal NOF. The caller stated that a case containing four one-gallon plastic jugs were punctured by a forklift at the loading terminal. The safety data sheet was reviewed with the caller, and advised that a contractor would be needed to complete the cleanup. Hulls arrived onsire, the team will downstack the pallet and collect the impacted jugs and they will neutralize the impacted area with vinegar. All waste will be placed into poly drums. Only one 55-gallon DF of spent absorbent and debris was generated for this spill. All waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024040884
item.description:
Report X-2024040884

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: SAINT PETERSBURG
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered and placed inside in line hazardous materials bin to be taken away to a secure location for processing. DescribePack: Upon inspection of contents it was determined that one of the bottles had a loose and missing cap which resulted in 2 quarts of product being released. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined bin and taken away to a secure location for processing while remnants were cleaned up.

item.title: Report X-2024040888
item.description:
Report X-2024040888

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: Contents were leaking from under the cap on 1 of the jerricans in the box, even though the cap was on tight. In tightening the cap further, the leakage slowed, but did not stop. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040968
item.description:
Report X-2024040968

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: OCOEE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought back to facility from driver as a damage off truck. The spill happened on the truck during transport and found by the driver. After dropping it off at QA, spill was dry and was put in a container with Hazmat bag. DescribePack: Package was poorly packaged with no packing material. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The release was on truck, at end of driver route spill was dry. PPE was taken place.

item.title: Report X-2024040798
item.description:
Report X-2024040798

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-14
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found in the HazMat Cage during morning audit. It was not sent as hazardous but someone wrote "leaking HazMat" on the box. It was later confirmed to be hazardous. DescribePack: The plastic jug's cap was loose and leaked within the box. Bottom of the box had failed due to leakage. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Someone had already placed the box within a red tote and HazMat bag inside the HazMat Cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. received damaged off trailer 808227, out of 305-MARI-A. Pkg. taken to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspecting container, it was noted the there was a crack on the bottom which caused about 4 oz. of liquid to leak out. Plastic Pail was not shipped in a fiberboard box. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: pail is inside a plastic bag in a bin, awaiting instructions from PGH.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had gotten wet on the bottom from rain, handlers disregarded arrows and placed package upside down, and dropped the package onto the tugger where it was brought to QA. The drop caused the seals on the bottles to burst and caused the cleaner liquid to spill from the caps, package handler had liquid spill onto him. Had first aid for exposure done, no injury report filed. DescribePack: Package had orientation arrows ignored and was dropped on the wrong side, causing the liquid to break the seals within the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a tote and placed properly following arrows, then was promptly moved into the hazardous cage for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024040827
item.description:
Report X-2024040827

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Corrosive hazmat package was found wet. Upon inspection found 2 bottles of Flora Fresh 2.5-gallon had defective lids which resulted to leakage. The lids were secured but liquid content were still seeping through lids. DescribePack: Bottles had defective lids which resulted to leakage. The lids were secured but liquid content were still seeping through lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.
